ygData.subject: Re: PoA bard quests plus a rant
ygData.msgSnippet: That an can a pet pull? Well actually yeah they kinda can but oh god you don t wanna see what comes if yer pet pulls :P Remember getting a bad lag spice as the
ygData.messageBody:
That an can a pet pull? Well actually yeah they kinda can but oh god you
don't wanna see what comes if yer pet pulls :P Remember getting a bad lag
spice as the hand in lguk got away with my pet on it pulling it to the
frenz. Oh god that was a nasty train.


>From: "Naeeldar" <jackal@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] PoA bard quests plus a rant
>Date: Thu, 27 Jan 2000 19:36:50 -0500
>
>Um who said's a pet isn't supposed to be better then another class? Did
>verant ever once state that? Again you can do other things to make up for
>melee so it's not unbalancing can my pet mes? charm? mana song ? heal song?
>Or hell can it even think? A pet in no case is a replacement for a real
>thinking tank not once have I ever seen somebody go no we don't want you
>for
>our group we got a necro pet or a magician pet.
>
>Naeeldar
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: kim@... <kim@...>
>To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Date: Thursday, January 27, 2000 6:33 PM
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] PoA bard quests plus a rant
>
>
> >From: <kim@...>
> >
> >On Thu, 27 Jan 2000, Naeeldar wrote:
> >>
> >> When you have a pet class it makes perfect sense. If you had wanted to
>be
> >> able to meele you should of picked a warrior or something else.
>Seriously
> >> what are you mad about? Some other class can do something you can't?
>grass
> >> is greener comes to my mind.
> >
> >I'm not mad about anything. I'm just pointing out that it's
> >obviously unbalanced, as counter to your claim that it's
> >balanced. Classes can do lots of stuff other classes can't
> >do. But when a class can do something they're not supposed to
> >do better than a class that's supposed to do it, something is
> >wrong.
> >
> >The "grass is greener" argument doesn't prove anything.
> >Either people are complaining because of the "grass is
> >greener" phenomenon, or they're complaining because there's a
> >real problem. Blaming it on "grass is greener" without
> >stating any points to back up your case really doesn't help us
> >determine what is the actual cause.
> >
> >--
> >John H. Kim
> >kim@...
